page.title: 16Attitudes in Alresford
page.content: In 1984, Alresford residents fought to save a favourite beauty spot in the village. Cockaynes Wood,part of an an- cient Domesday Book Manor, was under threat of being dug up for mineral ex- traction.Several residents were anx- ious to preserve ancient trees and woodland and popular picturesque foot- paths.Consequently letters of object- tion were sent to the Parish Coucil and Essex County Council calling for the original planning consent, granted in 1953, to be revoked. Some older Alresford residents tend to take a rather conservative att- itude towards newcomers.Since the ex- pansion of the village about sixteen years ago, when several new estates were built, many people have been moving in from London.A few establish- ed residents feel that the Cockneys are taking over Alresford.
